intro: Anthodon panamensis, commonly known as the Panama anthodon, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture. Anthodon panamensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
